Identification_Area.title: IHW COMET HALLEY INFRARED PHOTOMETRY, V2.0

Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: Sekanina, Zdenek (ed.), 'The Comet Halley Archive Summary Volume', Jet Propulsion Laboratory, California Institute of Technology, Pasadena, California, JPL D-400-450, August 1991.

Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_name: IHW COMET HALLEY INFRARED PHOTOMETRY, V2.0
Data_Set_PDS3.producer_full_name: GRAYZECK, E.J., KLINGLESMITH, D.A., III, NIEDNER, M.B., JR
Data_Set_PDS3.citation_text: Knacke, R.F. and T. Encrenaz, IHW COMET HALLEY INFRARED PHOTOMETRY, V2.0, IHW-C-IRPHOT-3-RDR-HALLEY-V2.0, NASA Planetary Data System. 2006.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: Infrared photometry of comet 1P/Halley collected by the International Halley Watch Infrared Studies Network
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: This data set presents the photometry of comet 1P/Halley collected by the International Halley Watch (IHW) Infrared Studies Network (IRSN) over the period September 1984 to April 1988. Version 2 includes data submitted after the initial archive generation.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview ================= This data set presents the photometry of comet 1P/Halley collected by the International Halley Watch (IHW) Infrared Studies Network (IRSN) over the period September 1984 to April 1988. Nearly all files contain magnitude measurements, although two files of flux measurements are also included. Version 2 includes data submitted as addenda after the initial archive generation.
The data have undergone substantial reformatting for Version 2, but none of the original data bytes have been changed. Format changes include:
o Incorporating all information from the FITS headers into the newly generated PDS labels.
o Calculating accurate START_TIME and STOP_TIME values, where sufficient information was available.
o Converting all data files from FITS ASCII tables to standard flat ASCII tables (i.e., with carriage control) with separate FITS headers.
o Locating and separating the two flux observations from the rest of the magnitude files.
o Subdividing the directory containing the magnitude files into subdirectories by month of observation.
o Adding three tables of data (47 observations total) submitted as addenda to the original archive (and archived with the PDS as data set EAR-C-IRPHOT-2-RDR-HALLEY-ADDENDA-V1.0) to the data/ collection in the addenda/ subdirectory.
In addition, all reported errata were corrected.
08 November 2006, A.C.Raugh
Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note: Confidence Level Overview ========================= In many cases error bars are included with the magnitudes reported. Where they are not, some additional information might be found in the DESCRIPTION text of the PDS label. Beyond that, specific details were not available.
